summary: This bill, the "Tax Delinquencies and Overdue Debts are Government Employees’ Responsibility Act" (TAX DODGER Act), mandates an annual report on federal employees and retirees with delinquent tax debt. It also makes individuals with seriously delinquent tax debt ineligible for federal employment, with exceptions for those under payment plans or facing legal challenges. Agencies are required to review public records and may request tax information disclosure. The bill also allows for adverse actions against employees for willful failures to file or understate taxes. The act takes effect 270 days after enactment.
